Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to produce a process tree that models the described process. We need to output the process tree in the textual notation as described using -> for sequence X for exclusive choice + for parallel * for loop Leaves are activity labels in single quotes like A RG etc Possibly tau for silent steps if needed

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the loop consists of SC -> (TM or SPT) -> RDT and then repeat from SC if abnormal. But note that after the initial diagnostic test we have a decision if abnormal -> loop else skip loop. So A = (SC -> XOR(TM SPT) -> RDT) Then after A either exit or do B tau then A again

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: to model optional loop zero or more times we could model as XOR between skipping the loop tau and doing the loop which executes at least once. That would correctly represent 0 or 1+ iterations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Overall Sequence leaf A leaf RG leaf IA Sequence TI TC XOR CE FBP XOR Loop tau + AI NC Sequence FAS DDI + BL ICP MRF

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: for three-way concurrency we can do + BL + ICP MRF since concurrency is associative that is fine

Name: Validation - PE
Text: after the loop exits we proceed to next steps. Thats consistent. The process overall can be structured as a big sequence from start to finish with internal nodes

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: we need to represent the whole process as a nested binary sequence. For a linear chain of sequential activities we can do ->A ->RG ->IA ...

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Thus the process tree is correct. All activities are included and the order matches the description
